intro: Ophrestia breviracemosa, commonly known as the short raceme ophrestia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple or pink. The plant produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, often found in moist, shaded environments. Ophrestia breviracemosa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
